pr_title: refactor(core): change AWS-prefixed date types to Temporal.*

timeline.message: refactor(core): change AWS-prefixed date types to Temporal.*

timeline.bodyText: missed these serializers, will do another commit addressing these
timeline.author: drochetti

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not crazy about having all of these crammed into one big file, though I understand there's not really another approach to achieve the naming strategy we agreed on.
One option would be to call these TemporalDate, TemporalDateTime, ...  instead of Temporal.Date , Temporal.DateTime?   I understand we already made a decision on the naming though, so I'm fine with what's in this PR.
timeline.author: richardmcclellan

replies.bodyText:
I had the same conflict tbh. I didn't think about this when we decided on the naming, but then one I saw that it was less than 1k lines and the IDE helps you navigate I decided not to bring yet another naming discussion to the surface at this point...
Also, iOS has an even bigger PR with the Temporal.* name. The difference is that there we can do extensions like in Kotlin, so we can divide each temporal in its own file by adding an extension to the namespace class.
replies.author: drochetti
